title: SHAP explanation in a text summarization model written in tensorflow.
body:
Hi,

Thanks for the library.

I'm trying to use shap to explain a special text summarization model, but I face some problems. I'm wondering whether the following model is supported.

```python
class ClassName():
     def f(X):
         tmp = X.copy()
         return self.myModel.predict(tmp)

     def explain(self):
         # An example of predict_lines is: ['save|class|to|file']
         predict_lines = readFromSomewhere()
         explainer = shap.Explainer(self.f)
         shap_values = explainer(predict_lines)
```

The input of the model is `predict_lines` (i.e., `sess.run([ret], feed_dict={self.predict_placeholder: predict_lines}`). In other words, tokenization is done inside the model. The procedure is different from the sample code in [here](https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example_notebooks/text_examples/summarization/Abstractive%20Summarization%20Explanation%20Demo.html#Create-an-explainer-object), which seems separate model and tokenizer. 

Any help is highly appreciated.
Thanks.
